subject: Politics
title: Sea Power
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sea Power.

hook.text: 90% of global trade moves by sea. Control the oceans and you control the world economy.

buildup.text: Alfred Mahan argued in the 1890s that naval power is the key to global dominance. His ideas still shape strategy.

discovery.text: The US Navy operates 11 aircraft carriers. No other nation has more than two. American sea power is unmatched.

twist.text: China is building the world's largest navy by ship count. It's challenging US dominance in the Pacific.

climax.text: Navies protect trade routes, project power, and enforce blockades. Whoever rules the seas shapes global order.

punchline.text: Trade sails the seas. Navies decide who trades freely and who doesn't.

quiz.question: How much of global trade moves by sea?
